title: 111_s1728
content: The Act titled "Service Members Home Ownership Tax Act of 2009" waives recapture of first-time homebuyer credit for individuals on qualified official extended duty. The Act "Service Members Home Ownership Tax Act of 2009" exempts members of the armed forces from recapture of first-time homebuyer credit for the disposition of a principal residence in connection with qualified official extended duty service after December 31, 2008. The Act "Service Members Home Ownership Tax Act of 2009" exempts members of the armed forces from recapture of first-time homebuyer credit for the disposition of a principal residence in connection with qualified official extended duty service after December 31, 2008. The term 'qualified official extended duty service' refers to service as a member of the uniformed services or a member of the Foreign. The amendment made by this section applies to dispositions and cessations after December 31, 2008 for members of the armed forces, Foreign Service of the United States, or employees of the intelligence community. Extension of first-time homebuyer credit for individuals on qualified official extended duty outside the United States. Extension of first-time homebuyer credit for individuals on qualified official extended duty outside the United States. Amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include special rules for individuals serving on qualified official extended duty outside the US for at least 90 days in 2009. Changes involve extending deadlines for certain provisions related to the purchase of a principal residence. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 extend the first-time homebuyer credit for individuals on qualified official extended duty outside the US. The amendments allow taxpayers to elect to treat a home purchase made after December 31, 2009, and before July 1, 2010, as if it was made on December 31, 2009. The effective date for these changes is residences purchased after November 30, 2009. SEC. 4 amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude qualified military base realignment and closure fringe from gross income. The effective date for these changes is after February 17, 2009. SEC. 5 increases the penalty for failure to file a partnership or S corporation return. SEC. 6 increases the percentage for corporate estimated tax payments by 0.5 percentage points. Effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2009.
